name: WaveFormer
description:
WaveFormer uses the volume from your microphone to create the amplitude for a waveform. Use mouse clicks to indicate when the waveform should cross the axis, and your waveform will be drawn. Manipulate your wave to collect wave-points on the level. Part strategy, part execution, part silliness.

Group and party play is recommended! What's better than yelling at your computer alone? Yelling into a microphone with friends! Have one person handle the mouse, while others contribute their voices to the magnitude of the wave! Good luck coordinating!

For additional challenge, try speed-running the game. Runners will find that the wave draws much slower when it is both high amplitude and high frequency. Comment your best times below!

WaveFormer was developed for Global Game Jam 2017 by the following people:

Tom Myers- Art

Jc Statt- Code, Design

Preston Vickers- Support

music by Tonebox
